newsitem.title: USA: Ford to suspend Thunderbird until 2000 - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Ford to suspend Thunderbird until 2000 - WSJ.

text.p: Ford Motor Co plans to suspend new models of its Thunderbird until the year 2000, the Wall Street Journal said in its Friday electronic edition.

The report, citing people familiar with the situation, said Ford plans to continue production of the 1997 model until the end of 1998 and has dropped plans for a 1998 model, which was intended to last until the year 2000.
The company could not be immediately reached for comment.

Friday's story said a Ford spokesman dismissed ongoing speculation that the company might sell its plant in Lorain, Ohio, where the slow-selling Thunderbird and Mercury Cougar mid-sized coupes are now made.
The story said last year's sales of the Thunderbird were 79,721, compared with 325,153 in 1977.
